Function Documentation

void DAC_Cmd ( HT_DAC_TypeDef *  HT_DACn,
u8  DAC_Ch,
ControlStatus  NewState 
)

Enable or Disable the specified DAC channel.

Parameters:
HT_DACn,:where HT_DACn is the selected DAC from the DAC peripherals.
DAC_Ch,:the DAC channel to configure This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • DAC_CH0 : DAC channel 0
  • DAC_CH1 : DAC channel 1
NewState,:This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
Return values:
None

u8  DAC_Ch 
)

Return the data output register value of the specified DAC channel.

Parameters:
HT_DACn,:where HT_DACn is the selected DAC from the DAC peripherals.
DAC_Ch,:the DAC channel to configure This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • DAC_CH0 : DAC channel 0
  • DAC_CH1 : DAC channel 1
Returns:
The selected DAC channel data output value.

void DAC_ModeConfig ( HT_DAC_TypeDef *  HT_DACn,
u8  ModeSel 
)

Configure the DAC conversion mode.

Parameters:
HT_DACn,:where HT_DACn is the selected DAC from the DAC peripherals.
ModeSel,:specify the conversion mode This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • ASYNC_MODE : asynchronous conversion mode
  • SYNC_MODE : synchronous conversion mode
Return values:
None

Definition at line 148 of file ht32f5xxxx_dac.c.

void DAC_ReferenceConfig ( HT_DAC_TypeDef *  HT_DACn,
u8  DAC_Ch,
u32  RefSel 
)

Configure the specified DAC channel reference voltage.

Parameters:
HT_DACn,:where HT_DACn is the selected DAC from the DAC peripherals.
DAC_Ch,:the DAC channel to configure This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • DAC_CH0 : DAC channel 0
  • DAC_CH1 : DAC channel 1
RefSel,:DAC reference voltage source This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • DAC_REFERENCE_VDDA : VDDA
  • DAC_REFERENCE_VREF : VREF
Return values:
None

Definition at line 101 of file ht32f5xxxx_dac.c.

void DAC_ResolutionConfig ( HT_DAC_TypeDef *  HT_DACn,
u8  DAC_Ch,
u32  ResoSel 
)

Configure the specified DAC channel resolution.

Parameters:
HT_DACn,:where HT_DACn is the selected DAC from the DAC peripherals.
DAC_Ch,:the DAC channel to configure This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • DAC_CH0 : DAC channel 0
  • DAC_CH1 : DAC channel 1
ResoSel,:DAC Channel Resolution This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • DAC_RESOLUTION_8BIT : 8-bit resolution
  • DAC_RESOLUTION_12BIT : 12-bit resolution
Return values:
None
